column4: hi is it normal for sshd to be running evern after I do a ./etc/init.d/ssh stop?
it gets a new pid so it does something,
how can I kill all open connections?
I do but it reopens with a new id
I had a hacker crack a password on a non privledged account and was running perl.
I deleted the user and home files but I cant get this sshd to stop running.
am I paranoid or is it just me. I stopped ssh at the firewall they arent getting in that way.
i do but a new pid gets created.
remove it from rc.d and then reboot
i recommend you install rkhunter and scan your system
otherwise I'd generate the MD5 here and give it
not sure, would make sense though
thanks anyway. I appreciate the attempt
if you can provide the full filename, maybe someone will play with you :)
